intro: Epilobium gracilipes var. concinnum, commonly known as the slender willow herb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves. The flowers are typically pink to reddish and are arranged in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. This variety is closely related to other species within the Epilobium genus, sharing similar botanical features and ecological preferences.
